availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frank Madden (Louisville, Kentucky, bookstore owner and quartermaster, 15th KY (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, book store owner and soldier. Brooklyn, New York native. Married to Anne McKenzie Madden in Louisville, Kentucky in 1846. Moved to Louisville, Kentucky in 1838. Owned a bookstore in Louisville, Kentucky. Volunteered as a fireman in Louisville, Kentucky. Served as quartermaster in the Fifteenth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.).

ab.bibl: "Pioneer Resident of Jefferson County Dies," Louisville Courier-Journal, 5 Dec 1910, 3. ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
